intro: Eskemukerjea, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other similar plants. The plant features showy, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white or pink petals. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in grasslands and open woodlands. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
